questions.question: What is the name of the compound with the formula MgBr<sub>2</sub> ?

What is the plum pudding model of the atom?

choices.answer: A ball of positive charge with negative electrons embedded in it
A ball of negative charge with positive electrons embedded in it
A ball of positive charge with negative neutrons  embedded in it

questions.question: An atom has an atomic number of 9 and a mass number of 19. What are its numbers of protons, neutrons and electrons?
What are isotopes?

choices.answer: Atoms of the same element with different numbers of neutrons
Atoms of the same element with different numbers of protons
Atoms of the same element with different numbers of electrons

questions.question: An atom of an element has the electronic structure 2,8,7. Which group of the periodic table is it in?
An atom of an element has the electronic structure 2,8,8,1. How many electrons are in the shell nearest the nucleus?
What happens to metal atoms in chemical reactions?

choices.answer: They lose electrons to form positive ions
They gain electrons to form negative ions
They lose electrons to form negative ions

questions.question: What the products of the reaction fo sodium and water?
Which two solutions react together in a displacement reaction?
Which of these statements about a negative ion is true?

choices.answer: It has an equal number of protons and electrons
It has more protons than electrons
It has more electrons than protons

questions.question: Bromine is in group 7 of the periodic table. What is the charge on its ions?

Which statement about different forms of carbon is correct?

choices.answer: Graphite and diamond conduct electricity but graphene does not
Graphite and graphene conduct electricity but diamond does not
Graphene and diamond conduct electricity but graphite does not

questions.question: What is the formula of buckminsterfullerene?
Which statement best explains why diamond has a high melting point?

choices.answer: A large amount of energy is needed to break its strong covalent bonds
A large amount of energy is needed to break its bonds

questions.question: Why are electrons in the outer shell of metal atoms free to move through the whole structure?

choices.answer: They have ions that can move

questions.question: Why can metals be bent and shaped?

choices.answer: Strong forces hold their atoms together
There atoms are arranged in layers which slide oever each other
Their atoms have a tetrahedral arrangement

When preparing a salt, why is the saturated solution of the salt left in a warm, dry place for rather than heated?

choices.answer: To speed   up the evaporation of the water
To allow   large crystals to form

questions.question: What does the law of conservation of mass state?

choices.answer: No atoms are lost or made in a chemical reaction
Atoms are lost but not made in a chemical reaction
Atoms are made but not lost in a chemical reaction
